intro: Leucanthemum lawatum, commonly known as the oxeye daisy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its white ray florets surrounding a central yellow disk, giving it a daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers full sun to partial shade. It thrives in well-drained soil and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides. Leucanthemum lawatum is also cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
